item.title: Swift Expressible Literal
item.description: This is the English version of my post at cnblogs.com. A Question Given the code bellow: 1 2 3 4 5 struct Book { let name: String } let book: Book = "Charlotte's Web" Is there a way to make it work? So, is there a way to implicitly create a struct from a string literal? Expressible Literal Protocol The answer is yes, with the the magic of expressible literal protocol.
